1.text: Come, and let us return to the LORD: for he has torn, and he will heal us; he has smitten, and he will bind us up.

2.text: After two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up, and we shall live in his sight.

3.text: Then shall we know, if we follow on to know the LORD: his going forth is prepared as the morning; and he shall come to us as the rain, as the latter and former rain to the earth.

4.text: O Ephraim, what shall I do to you? O Judah, what shall I do to you? for your goodness is as a morning cloud, and as the early dew it goes away.

5.text: Therefore have I hewed them by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of my mouth: and your judgments are as the light that goes forth.

6.text: For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.

7.text: But they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.

8.text: Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, and is polluted with blood.

9.text: And as troops of robbers wait for a man, so the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.

10.text: I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there is the prostitution of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.

11.text: Also, O Judah, he has set an harvest for you, when I returned the captivity of my people.
